intro: Maesa tenuifolia, commonly known as the slender leaf maesa, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in horticulture and ecological studies.
